title: Malcolm Butler (Irish footballer)
text:
Malcolm Partridge Butler (6 August 1913 – December 1987) was a Northern Irish professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a full back in <a href="The%20Football%20League">The Football League</a> for <a href="Blackpool%20F.C.">Blackpool</a> and <a href="Accrington%20Stanley%20F.C.%20%281891%29">Accrington Stanley</a>. He also won one <a href="cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Ireland%20national%20football%20team%20%281882%E2%80%931950%29">Ireland</a>.
Club career.
<a href="Belfast">Belfast</a>-born Butler left <a href="Belfast%20Celtic%20F.C.">Belfast Celtic</a> to sign for <a href="Blackpool%20F.C.">Blackpool</a> in January 1935. His four-year career with the club was ended by the outbreak of the <a href="World%20War%20II">Second World War</a>.
During the war he guested for both <a href="Chelsea%20F.C.">Chelsea</a> and <a href="Brighton%20%26amp%3B%20Hove%20Albion%20F.C.">Brighton</a>, playing around his time as a Flight-Lieutenant navigator in the <a href="Royal%20Air%20Force">Royal Air Force</a>.
In July 1947 he signed with <a href="Accrington%20Stanley%20F.C.%20%281891%29">Accrington Stanley</a>, and <a href="captain%20%28association%20football%29">captained</a> the club to a sixth-place finish in the <a href="Football%20League%20Third%20Division">Football League Third Division</a> North before retiring in May 1948.
International career.
On 15 March 1939, he played for <a href="Ireland%20national%20football%20team%20%281882%E2%80%931950%29">Ireland</a> in their 3–1 defeat to <a href="Wales%20national%20football%20team">Wales</a>. It was the country's last match before <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>.
Post-retirement.
After leaving the game he became a licensee in <a href="Blackpool">Blackpool</a>.
